TopicTitle: Devnote Tuesdays: The Happy New Year Edition

Articles.Content:
<p><img alt="image" src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/0ff9377afa68dc3ad3fe6844aaf1bd38/tumblr_inline_mz1n7aKZRg1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p>It’s officially our second day back from holiday and we’re just getting back in the groove, so allow us to recount our time off and bask in one last moment of relaxation before 2014 and all the craziness it will bring, kicks in 100%:</p>

<p id="docs-internal-guid-15456331-6f34-916f-9b99-a4b9bae41b3d"><strong>Felipe (HarvesteR)</strong><span><strong>:</strong> Getting back into it after a very welcome holiday break. Got around yesterday and today to doing a couple of tweaks on some areas of the game that IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been wanting to have a look at for a while (more on that later), to build up some dev momentum again. WeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re just starting the planning stage for the next update right now, so there isnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t much else to share just yet, but IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m very much looking forward to starting work on the next big things we have lined up.</span></p>

<p><strong>Jim (Romfarer)</strong><span><strong>:</strong> I had a great Christmas holiday. I ate a lot of ribbe, pinnekjÃƒÂ¸tt and lutefisk </span></p>

<p><strong>Daniel (danRosas)</strong><span><strong>:</strong> Had a nice time visiting the family over the holidays. </span></p>

<p><span><strong>Alex (aLeXmOrA):</strong> *</span><span>Enjoyed the holidays by resting all days laying in my couch reading two amazing books: Ã¢â‚¬Å“World War ZÃ¢â‚¬Â and Ã¢â‚¬Å“CarrieÃ¢â‚¬Â (much better than the movies). Also had lots of food for Christmas and New YearsÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ Eve with the family. 2014 seems to be a good year!</span></p>

<p><strong>Marco (Samsonart): *</strong><span>Getting back from the Holidays, lots of food and good times, I was still fulfilling the Tech Support duties, but it was an overall quiet and relaxing time.</span></p>

<p><strong>Mike (Mu):</strong><span> Had a reasonably relaxing holiday. </span></p>

<p><span><strong>Ted (Ted):</strong> </span><span>Had a great holiday, rediscovered the concept of relaxation and idle time. Also got some great game-playing in and spent some time with family. Looking forward to 0.24 and beyond!</span></p>

<p><span><strong>Miguel (Maxmaps):</strong> </span><span>Spent a huge amount of time with family and friends as well as playing a ton of games. Also a small amount of time observing communities, talking to youtubers and streamers from the comfort of anonimity. </span></p>

<p><span><strong>Anthony (Rowsdower):</strong> I spent my break doing a lot of cooking, a lot of eating and ultimately spending way too much money on games featured Steam’s holiday sale. In between then, though, I made sure to keep up with my community postings as much as I could.</span></p>

We're all a little fatter after christmas.

Welcome back, people!
Welcome back from a well-deserved break! Already looking forward to next tuesday!
Romfarer is a squad dev now?!?! Thats awesome! (And also explains why he does't have time to fix the lazor system)

Romfarer is a squad dev now?!?! Thats awesome! (And also explains why he does't have time to fix the lazor system)

Umm...good for you?

Happy to read that you're not alone. Terrrrrriiiiible sales this year on Steam.

I have a question to the team; did you play KSP, or do you, sometimes, play KSP on your freetime? Just to play?

Happy to read that you're not alone. Terrrrrriiiiible sales this year on Steam.

I have a question to the team; did you play KSP, or do you, sometimes, play KSP on your freetime? Just to play?

If they didn't it'd be like owning a theme park and not riding that gigantic roller coaster every day
"ribbe", "pinnekjÃƒÂ¸tt" and "lutefisk" are words from the norwegian language, try google translate:wink:

Aww! Now I have to wait another week to find out 0.24s big stuff!

But seriously, you guys work really hard and you deserved a good Christmas break. Happy new year!

ribbe, pinnekjÃƒÂ¸tt and lutefisk

That sounds positively swedish. I'm sure I know what ribbe is, but I'm not sure about pinnekjÃƒÂ¸tt and lutefisk. Well, fisk means fish in, and kjÃƒÂ¸tt is swedish for meat.

It's nice that danish and swedish are so much alike each other, I can understand written and most spoken swedish, but there's a lot of traditions that's specific for each scandinavian country, so no bonus there.

EDIT: Apparently, it is norwegian. The difference is very small.
